march

private final int[] march

thinFilter

private static final boolean[] thinFilter
Lookup table for whether to cull points forming thin bridges. The index into this is the byte bitpattern implied by the neighbour array. This table is generated interactively by the program org.reprap.utilities.FilterGenerator.

neighbourProduct

private final int[] neighbourProduct
Lookup table behaves like scalar product for two neighbours i and j; get it by neighbourProduct[Math.abs(j - i)]

findUnvisitedNeighbourOnEdgeInDirection

private BooleanGrid.iPoint findUnvisitedNeighbourOnEdgeInDirection(BooleanGrid.iPoint a,
                                                                   int nd)
Find a neighbour of a pixel that has not yet been visited, that is on an edge, and that is nearest to a given neighbour direction, nd. If nd < 0 the first unvisited neighbour is returned. If no valid neighbour exists, null is returned. This prefrs to visit valid pixels with few neighbours, and only after that tries to head in direction nd.

Parameters:
a -
direction -
Returns:

hatch

private BooleanGrid.iPolygon hatch(RrHalfPlane h)
Generate a sequence of point-pairs where the line h enters and leaves solid areas. The point pairs are stored in a polygon, which should consequently have an even number of points in it on return.

Parameters:
h -
Returns:

offset

public BooleanGrid offset(double dist)
Offset the pattern by a given real-world distance. If the distance is negative the pattern is shrunk; if it is positive it is grown;

Parameters:
dist -
Returns:

complement

public BooleanGrid complement()
Complement a grid N.B. the grid doesn't get bigger, even though the expression it contains may now fill the whole of space.

Returns:
